text:
Hi.. this is Ceema and I am back with a
new lesson on expressions using the word 'Can't'
{10 Idiomatic Expressions with the modal verb “can’t”}

Now can't is a contraction of the word
cannot meaning that when you use the

word can't you use it in a negative
sentence, right? So I believe that the

expressions using this word are going to
be quite interesting. Let's have a look

at a few of them. The first one is - You
can't be bothered. Okay, when I use the

expression 'Can't be bothered' in a
sentence, what does that mean? It means

that something is not important, so it's
not important enough for your attention

or there is something that you don't
have the time, you've got no time or you

don't have the  interest. So, you've no time or no
interest or to do it or  to say it perhaps

someone may be a friend of yours
invited you to a game of football and

you think that playing football is not
important enough for your.... for your

attention or you don't have the time or
the interest to do that, so you will
say - I can't be bothered to spend my afternoon playing football, I'd rather do
some work instead, okay. So that's the way you will use this expression using the

word 'Can't'. The next one is - 'Can't tell'
Okay this expression 'Can't tell' can

have two different meanings -  when you
use the word can't tell with the words
if or whether

then this expression basically means
that you can't understand,  you can't

observe or you can't perceive you can't
see very clearly you can't observe or

perceive. So, suppose you are in the
darkroom okay, or in a room which is not

very well lit and there is a beautiful
dress okay, but you can't tell or you can't

understand or observe or perceive the
difference between the color blue and

black because the room is not very well
lit so you will say something like - I can't

tell if this dress is blue or black
because you can't see very clearly, you can't

understand that very clearly, right? So
when you use the expression 'Can't tell'

with if or whether following this
expression then this is what the meaning

comes out to be for this expression but
if this expression is used without this

if you use only this expression it
basically means you can't give out

information basically you are not
allowed to give out information so if
someone asked you a question about... you know... your private life and you will say

I'm sorry I can tell you it's
confidential so that basically means

that you can't or you refused to give out
certain kind of information

okay so depending on whether you are using
the 'Can't tell' with the 'if and whether or

if you are using it by itself the
meaning is going to be different
okay! The next one is - When you can't carry a tune
the word tune refers to music

okay  when you say you can't carry a
tune, you're basically saying that

someone or maybe yourself you have no
musical ability which means when you

saying you know there is a very high
probability that people are going to run

out... you know... the rats are gonna be
screaming okay, well so can't carry a tune is

someone who has less or 
basically no musical ability he can't

really... you know.... sing a note on its
tune, he can really sing at all

okay, that's what it means. And the next
expression 'Can't Wait'  is an expression

you use when you are very eager or very
excited for something to take place

okay, so I can say something like - I can't
wait to travel to New York for my

vacation this year because you are very
eager you are very excited for that
event to take place

okay, and the next one is - When you can't
get enough of something, Can't get enough

basically is an expression to show that
you want more, you want more and more
of something. This can refer to some people who are addicted to a thing a person or a

specific event perhaps, so if you like a
singer like Nicki Minaj your love

listening to her songs so you can see
something like I can't get enough of

Niki Minaj... you know... I can't get enough
of ice cream because you love ice cream

you want more and more of it, okay nothing
is ever enough for you as far as that thing is
concerned because you really love it a lot

Alright, now moving on to the next
expression using the word can't is a very
common expression called - Can't stand
now 'Can't stand' is basically an expression you use when you are talking about

something that annoys you or something
that irritates you okay, something that annoys you or
irritates you it's something that you can't and you will not stand, right? Now

this expression can be used in two
different ways

in  both the ways it's gonna  have
the same meaning, but the first way of
using 'Can't Stand'  is when you say Can't stand followed by a noun for example you can

say - I can't stand cigarette smoke. So
cigarette smoke is my noun.
or you can say - I can't stand .. a noun like say... my brother,  I can't stand my brother, why?

because he annoys me, he irritates me.
The other way of using 'Can't stand' is

when you use 'Can't stand' followed by
'it' which is again followed by 'when'  plus any

situation that you want to talk about.
So you can say something like - I can't

stand it when I have to wait in line for
the bus. So, I have used the word 'Can't stand'
by the word 'it' followed by another word  called 'when' and then I put in a

situation. I can't stand it when people
scream or yell at me

I can't stand it when I have to wait very
long to get what I want, okay. So, two

different ways of using the expression
'Can't stand' which have the same meaning but
two different ways of using it, okay.
The next one is - When you 'Can't bear' something, so 'Can't bear'  basically means you get

you are extremely sad or something is
very difficult for you to endure or to

go through, okay. So you can say something
like -  I can't bear to look at dogs who

are on the road who are dying or who
don't get enough to eat because you feel

extremely sad or it's difficult for you
to bare or endure the thought of

looking at dogs who are hungry or
starving on the road

that's what 'Can't bear' is,  when you can't
endure it, when you feel sad about
something. The next one is -  When you 'Can't help' something... can't help is basically an

expression used when you want to convey
the message saying that ...you can't

prevent or shall we say you can't stop
prevent or stop something happening.

or you can't prevent or stop feeling in a
certain way.So, if I'm talking about

not being able to stop or not
being able to prevent from something

happening I can say something like - 
I can't help  putting the brakes
on time because my car is faulty. The engine of my car is faulty.  So you can't prevent

your car from skidding perhaps right?
because of something that is wrong with
your car but if you can't help feeling in a certain way you can say something like -

The boy couldn't help falling in love with
the girl because she was very beautiful.
right? So, 'Can't help' is basically

used when you are talking about a
feeling that ....you know ...that you can't

really do anything about or a thing from
happening which can be stopped
alright, and the next one is - when you can't beat something, so can't beat is an

expression you use when something best
takes place or an event which is the

best happens so there's nothing that can
top it off
okay, so for example you can say that -Our vacation at the beach
nothing can beat that or you can't beat that, right? so you can't beat basically

is an expression you use when you're
talking about an event which is the best

event that can actually take place with
yourself

okay and the last expression using this
word is 'Can't thank you enough'

well! the word 'Thank' talks about gratitude or
feeling very thankful when you use that

expression you are basically expressing
your deepest gratitude to a person to a
company to people who have helped you through your difficult times or who have done

something very good for you so you can
say something like- I can't thank you

enough for helping me when I had a
financial need.

So basically these are the main
expressions using the word 'Cant'. I hope

you found them very interesting and very
informative, I will be back with some more

lessons until then this is me saying
goodbye...
